author: The Editorial Board
title: Political Sex-Trafficking Exploitation
text:
Bipartisanship isn’t always a force for good. See how plaintiff attorneys are trying to exploit political fury at Silicon Valley and online sex-trafficking to blow a hole in a law that has been crucial to internet freedom.

The House this week passed legislation that would create a carve-out to Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act of 1996 for online sex trafficking. Senator Rob Portman (R., Ohio) has introduced a companion bill that has 66 co-sponsors. Section 230 says “no provider or user of an interactive computer...
